Namespaces

namespace  boost
namespace  boost::xint
 

The common functions are within this namespace.


namespace  boost::xint::detail
 

The items within this namespace are meant for internal use only.


namespace  boost::xint::blockable
 

Contains the blockable integer type, and functions to operate on it.


namespace  boost::xint::core
 

Contains the "pure" integer type, and functions to operate on it.

Modular math functions

A common reason to use a large-integer library is to implement public-key encryption, and the algorithms for such encryption often use modular math.

integer boost::xint::core::mod (const integer &n, const integer &m)
 Get the remainder after dividing a number by another.
integer boost::xint::core::mulmod (const integer &n, const integer &by, const integer &m)
 Get the modular product of two integers.
integer boost::xint::core::sqrmod (const integer &n, const integer &m)
 Get the modular product of squaring an integer.
integer boost::xint::core::powmod (const integer &n, const integer &e, const integer &m, bool noMontgomery)
 Get the result of ne % m, keeping the intermediate results (relatively) small.
integer boost::xint::core::invmod (const integer &n, const integer &m)
 Get the modular inverse of a number in a modulus, if there is one.

Exception-blocking and -allowing functions

See the exception-blocking page for details on these functions and how to use them.

bool boost::xint::exceptions_allowed ()
 Query whether exceptions are currently allowed or blocked.
token boost::xint::block_exceptions ()
 Temporarily prevent the library from throwing blockable exceptions.
token boost::xint::allow_exceptions ()
 Temprarily counteract an xint::block_exceptions token to allow all exceptions.

Some constants used by the library.

const size_t boost::xint::detail::bits_per_digit = std::numeric_limits<digit_t>::digits
const digit_t boost::xint::detail::digit_hibit = (digit_t(1) << (bits_per_digit-1))
const doubledigit_t boost::xint::detail::doubledigit_hibit = (doubledigit_t(1) << (bits_per_digit*2-1))
const doubledigit_t boost::xint::detail::digit_overflowbit = (doubledigit_t(1) << bits_per_digit)
const digit_t boost::xint::detail::digit_mask = digit_t(digit_overflowbit-1)

Detailed Description

The main header file for the XInt library.

This is the only header that programs using the library should need to include.

Definition in file xint.hpp.

Generated on Sun Apr 11 10:17:00 2010 for The Extended Integer (XInt) Library by  1.6.3
